_comment: Project Coulomb — Shell Offshore Inc. deepwater GoM producing asset (MC613 + MC657). Shell holds 100% WI (87.5% NRI). NSAI PRMS Report as of June 30, 2018 by Netherland Sewell & Associates. TSB decom study September 2018. P&L from VDR. Evaluation date: October 2018.

_sources.nsai_report: NSAI Shell Coulomb PRMS Rpt.pdf — Netherland Sewell & Associates, Aug 27 2018. PDP PV10=$1.026B (at Shell price deck $59-75/bbl). 1P=48.3 MMBoe, 2P=89.6 MMBoe.
_sources.pl_summary: Coulomb_PL Summary_2016-2018 Sept YTD. 2016 opex=$18.9M, 2017=$29.5M, 2018 9m=$16.9M. 2018 Q3 avg production=~24k boepd (100% WI).
_sources.decom_study: 2018 Coulomb Decom Study Rev2.pdf — TSB Offshore. Total P50 ARO=$76.2M (MC657 C2=$23.4M, C4=$23.7M, MC613 C003=$23.5M, pipelines/jumpers=$5.6M).
_sources.lease: 3 1 Coulomb LEASE DESCRIPTION.pdf. Shell Offshore Inc. 100% WI, 87.5% NRI. GoM federal royalty 12.5% (MMS/BOEM). MC613 OCS-G 19974 (1998), MC657 OCS-G 08496 (1986). Held by production.
_sources.price_deck_notes: WTI $65/bbl (spot Oct 2018). Shell NSAI deck used $59.30→$75/bbl escalating. Differential $2/bbl transport/quality.
_sources.production_notes: H2 2018 NSAI: 4,421.9 MBOE in 184 days = 24,032 bopd annualised (100% WI). Production mix H2-2018: 53.5% oil / 46.5% gas-BOE. Decline 15%/yr derived from NSAI profile: 2019 16,194 bopd → 2024 6,299 bopd = -16.6%/yr CAGR. Uptime 92% (Shell-operated deepwater).
_sources.loe_notes: NSAI-implied PDP LOE $5.3-5.8/BOE at high production rates (2019-2020). Using $7/BOE to reflect buyer takeover and lower-production periods. Pipeline tariffs $1.50/BOE from historical P&L avg ($1.1-1.8/BOE 2016-2018).
_sources.acquisition_notes: Bid price $700M = 68% of NSAI PDP PV10 ($1.026B at Shell deck). Equivalent to ~$14.50/BOE of PDP reserves (48.3 MMBOE). Within typical deepwater GoM producing asset range ($10-25/BOE PDP).
